result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Daniel G Minnema was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Comply with treatment.  Cuont 2 and civil case dismissed.

records.addlTxt: Remaining confinement converted to Extended Supervision
from Black River Correctional Center with requested Amendment to JOC converting remaining confinement to Extended Supervision
Aug. 31, 2015 hearing filed by Court Reporter Marjorie Kurtz
To show Substance Abuse allowed and Challenge Program not allowed.
Associated with Charge #1
Filed by defendant/counsel.
Same counts carried forward.
Filed by defendant/counsel.

Defendant Daniel G Minnema  #207716 in court, in custody with attorney Mark W. Frank.  Troy D Cross appeared for the 
State of Wisconsin.  Waiver to Right of Preliminary Hearing filed; rights.  Court accepted, probable cause found, bound over for further proceedings.  Information filed.  Counts carried forward from Amended Complaint.  Reading waived.  Rights/elements.  Ct 1:  Guilty plea.  Court adjudged guilty and entered JOC.  Ct 2 and civil case dismissed.  Court imposed 8 years prison consecutive to sentence currently serving :  3 years initial confinement, 5 years extended supvervision.  3 years rovocation, 3 years ignition interlock, AODA and treatment, DNA sample and $250.00 surcharge.  Not to possess/consume alcohol.  Fine none.  Jail Credit: none.  Not eligible for Challenge Program, is eligible for EERP.
